In each course, I strive to cultivate an [inclusive and equitable classroom](inclusion.html) and to ground the methodology in data ethics.

## Macalester College

**STAT/COMP 112: Intro to Data Science**

-   Topics: Foundational Data Visualization, Data Wrangling, & Data Storytelling
-   \[[F22](https://bcheggeseth.github.io/112_fall_2022/)\], \[[S23](https://bcheggeseth.github.io/112_spring_2023/)\], \[[F23](https://bcheggeseth.github.io/112_fall_2023/)\], \[[F24](https://bcheggeseth.github.io/112_fall_2024/)\]

**STAT 155: Intro to Statistical Modeling**

-   Topics: Linear & Logistic Regression Models, Uncertainty (hypothesis testing, confidence intervals)
-   [Course notes](https://bcheggeseth.github.io/Stat155Notes/) in collaboration with Leslie Myint and Kelsey Grinde
-   \[F18\], \[F19\], \[F20\], \[S26\]

**STAT 202: Data & Society**

- [F25], [S26]

**STAT/COMP 212: Intermediate Data Science**

-   Topics: Advanced Data Visualization, Data Wrangling, Programming in R, & Data Storytelling
-   Textbook: R for Data Science by Wickhan, Ã‡etinkaya-Rundel, and Grolemund
-   \[F24\], \[[S25](https://bcheggeseth.github.io/212_spring_2025/)\]

**STAT 253: Statistical Machine Learning**

-   Topics: Regression, Classification, Clustering
-   Textbook: An Introduction to Statistical Learning by James, Witten, Hastie, and Tibshirani
-   [\[F21\]](https://bcheggeseth.github.io/253_fall_2021/), [\[S24\]](https://bcheggeseth.github.io/253_spring_2024/), [\[S25\]](https://bcheggeseth.github.io/253_spring_2025/)

**STAT 452: Correlated Data**

-   Topics: Covariance/Correlation functions and matrices, time series (ARMA models), longitudinal (marginal and mixed effects models), spatial
-   [Course notes](https://bcheggeseth.github.io/CorrelatedData/)
-   \[S19\], \[F19\], \[[S22](https://bcheggeseth.github.io/452_spring_2022/)\], \[[F23](https://bcheggeseth.github.io/452_fall_2023/)\], \[F25\]

**STAT 455: Mathematical Statistics**

-   Topics: Properties of estimators, Estimation techniques, mathematical properties of uncertainty estimates
-   \[S19\]

**STAT/COMP 456: Projects in Data Science**

-   Topics: Advanced DS skills, Data Science process
-   \[S23\]
